intro: Senecio bracteolatus var. valderramae, commonly known as the Valderrama senecio, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
